title.narrative: 1.3 CAPACITY OF ELECTED OFFICIALS

description.narrative: By 2016, enhanced capacity of elected officials in the National Assembly and in selected Provincial People's Councils to oversee the realisation of child rights, policy formulation and implementation, and the performance of State agencies in delivering services to children and their caregivers, which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Human Rights Institutions, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment, Public Finance And Local Governance, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence, Social Protection, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2016, a more effective national social protection system provides increased coverage, quality, and equitable access for the most vulnerable and disadvantaged groups

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2016, enhanced capacity of elected officials in the National Assembly and in selected Provincial People?s Councils to overseethe realisation of child rights, policy formulation and implementation, and the performance of State agencies in deliveringservices to children and their caregivers

description.narrative: The national legal frameworks and policy actions with an impact on children further improved and were better aligned with international child rights standards and best practices. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/12/2016

title.narrative: Number of new national and provincial children

target.value: 2016:6 fora in total, of which 2 national and 4 provincial

actual.value: 2014:Lessons learnt from various children's forums organised in 2013, were documented and finalised for further improvement of children's forums that will be organised in 2015. As officially agreed by leaders of the government and the National Assembly, a national children's forum is organised every two

title.narrative: Number of child rights oversight tools developed and made available to elected officials in the National Assembly and in selected Provincial People

target.value: 2014:3 [Tool to oversee child right to protection and education]

actual.value: 2014:Given the shift in programme priorities, it was decided to replace the tools to oversee child right to protection and education by tools on child sensitive SEDP and child budget oversight. A draft tool on child sensitive SEDP was developed and it is ready for consultation with MPs for finalisation.

title.narrative: Extent to which elected officials have access to strategic information on the situation of children to inform their appraisal of the revision of the Law on Protection, Care, and Education of Children

actual.value: 2014:Three policy briefs have been developed to influence amendment of the Child Law and the Environmental Protection Law. Additionally, key child rights issues regarding the Law on Local Governance, State Budget Law, Law on Laws and Child Law have been documented and discussed with MPs to inform the on-

title.narrative: Availability of a feasibility study on the establishment of an independent child rights monitoring mechanisms and follow-up discussion with the Standing Committee of the National Assembly and key agencies organised

target.value: 2016:A feasibility study on the establishment of an independent child rights monitoring mechanisms and follow-up discussion with the Standing Committee of the National Assembly and key agencies organised

actual.value: 2014:A plan for undertaking the feasibility study has been discussed with counterparts. As soon as the fund is transferred by the Norwegian Embassy, the study will be commissioned.

title.narrative: Number of guidelines developed in accordance with minimum standards of child participation, and used by elected officials to interact and consult with children, especially vulnerable and disadvantaged groups

target.value: 2016:2 guidelines available and being used by elected officials

actual.value: 2014:Analysis on child participation situation was completed as an entry for developing guidelines for systematic consultation with children.
